direction.raw_text: An abandoned looking trailer sits on top of two 15-foot-tall oil drums. Distant thunder trembles through the peeling metal panels. The structure is in such disrepair, that surely no one lives here. But then, a light goes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tiny hand sculpts the mud on top of a crawfish hole placed on the floor. We pan up to reveal a little girl examining a baby chicken that appears to be dead. This is HUSHPUPPY, an unkempt and seemingly uncared for six-year-old with a gaze of unmistakable wisdom. Hushpuppy places the chick on the crawfish hole, like a queen on her throne and the chick twitches to life, cheeps twice. Hushpuppy's esoteric science experiment is interrupted by
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Her eyes stand to attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An eerie, harsh wind whips hay and dust through over a giant slumbering pot-belly pig. Hushpuppy, donned in boys' underpants and a child-sized wife- beater, tip-toes behind the epic creature. She studies it, wonderful, is this the source of the thunder? With the utmost delicacy, she lays a hand on the pig's belly. We hear his HUGE BEATING HEART.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A series of glimpses of Hushpuppy's scientific method. She chases geese, chickens, ducks, dogs around the property- a cross between an abandoned farm and salvage yard. Hushpuppy grabs a baby chick and puts it to her ear. A TINY HEARTBEAT. She listens with focused wonder and intensity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) All the time, everywhere, everything's organs be beatin' and squirtin' and talkin' to each other in ways I can't understand. Mosta the time they probably just sayin' "I'm hungry," or "I gotta poop," but sometimes they talkin' in codes. Hushpuppy's eyes dart up as a MAN'S VOICE yells-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Get up, get out of here! We hear a YOWL as a cat is flung across the room. A window made from a gas station sign opens in a Robinson Crusoe style tree house patched together from storm debris and discarded appliances. A wild man with severe features, a frazz of unkempt hair, and brawler's scars opens a window made from a metal sign. This is WINDELL EMMETT DOUCET, known to all as WINK (39).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get your pants on, man! Wink kills a beer and sends it out the hole in the wall into a basketball hoop attached to a fishing net that stretched 15 feet down to the ground. The net is overflowing with beer cans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy obediently climbs a series of increasingly bigger and bigger oil drums that function like a ladder, up to the door of her house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We now see Wink in his morning ritual. He opens a cooler with a butchered chicken inside it and tosses the bird on the grill. He goes to the front porch and pours down a bag of dog food. He pulls a clothesline that leads to Hushpuppy's trailer. A BELL RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feed up time! Feed up! Hushpuppy, now wearing pants and a slightly more proper T- shirt, comes running down the oil barrels to her house. She echoes her Daddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feed up time! Feed up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy devours the whole roast chicken with her hands, getting right in there like it was a candy apple. It looks really yummy. Pigs, dogs, chickens, and cats are chowing down all around her. A hatch opens above her and we realize we're in the bottom of the Shacko. Wink sticks his head through the hatch and throws corn to the chickens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Share with the dogs. Hushpuppy rips off a piece of chicken and flings it to a filthy chihuahua with no hair on the back half of its body. This is WINDELL, in spite of her circumstances, quite a handsome young pup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , we see Hushpuppy and Wink drift through the marsh. They ride in a severed truck bed floating on top of oil drums. A motor is strapped to the back. A sign on the boat reads "The Turck", Hushpuppy's spelling of "Truck". They look out to where the water goes all the way to a monolithic, 20 foot wall stretching infinitely into the distance. This levee, the first piece of modern construction we've seen, encloses the civilized world, protecting it from rising water. The Bathtub is on the wrong side of wall. Wink stares out at the distant factories behind the wall with a peaceful and confident disdain. Hushuppy matches his relaxed defiant expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't that ugly over there? He takes a long pull on his beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We live in the prettiest place on earth. Hushpuppy looks over the wall to the Dry Side. It's an endless sprawl of oil processing power plants without a tree or bird in sight. This is the engine that runs the Northern world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Daddy says, up above the levee, on the dry side, they're afraid of the water like a bunch of babies. They built the wall that cuts us off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AERIAL BATHTUB - DAY We fly over marsh and water, coming upon a tiny crop of shanties on an island perched at the very bottom of the land.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) They think we all gonna drown down here. But we ain't goin' nowhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON Hushpuppy letting out a WARRIOR SCREAM in a mass of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: people. They stand on a long and crumbling road surrounded on both sides by water. The rag tag band of revelers charge forward
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and SHOUTING. Hushpuppy kisses her hand and smacks the town sign. "Isle de Charles Doucet" is crossed out and someone has graffitied "The Bathtub." Each party-goer repeats Hushpuppy's kiss and smack in wild, ritualistic fashion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The Bathtub's got more holidays than the whole rest of the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAFOURCHE ROAD - DAY The townspeople charge in a rousing parade. Everyone drags trails of beer cans, boat parts, anything they can tie to themselves that makes a lot of noise. They are the hard faces of fishermen and their feisty wives, downtrodden but with a sense of fortitude among them, a community of heart, spirit, passion, and reckless abandon. We see none of the separations that we're used to in modern society. There is no evidence of politics, religion, class, race or any other divisive ideology. The Bathtub is a place of true and honest unity. Megaphones sticking out a gutted mini-van broadcast the Cajun band playing inside. Fiddle, saw, guitar, and double-bass players struggle to hold onto their instruments and the truck bounces them down a dirt road. They drive under a banner reading "Welcome to the Bathtub Storm Season!" Wink and Hushpuppy rattle along on a float made from the front end of a pickup truck. Over the front cabin rears a giants sculpture of a horse-head made out of wooden spikes, metal plates, and heavy chains. Carnival-dressed maniacs clamber on top. Wink hollers and waves to people. He fires jets of beer into the mouths of the crowd. Hushpuppy dances on the back of the float. Though she's the tiniest member of this very adult parade, she's right in the thick of everything. No one is checking I.Ds Here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Daddy always saying, that up in the dry world, they got none of what we got.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The town dances around the band in a clearing in the woods. Everyone is bouncing to the music, smiling and joking with one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) They only got holidays once a year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six babies, each with a racing number pinned to their diaper, are placed by their enthusiastic mammas at a starting-line on a track marked by two adjacent crowds of onlookers. Bets are flying between the spectators as if they're about to watch a cock-fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) All babies to the race! Come up to the starting line! The baby race is about to begin. Hushpuppy dances in the cheering crowd, swigging a bottle of something she probably shouldn't have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: fires, and the babies make a crawl for it. Most of them are paralysed in tears or bewilderment, but one brave soul toddles towards victory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) They got fish stuck in plastic wrappers, they got their babies stuck in carriages, and chickens on sticks and all that kind of stuff. Hushpuppy looks up at Wink who is dancing with his best friend WALRUS (60), a slack jawed, white haired, pinked nosed, handsome devil. A baby crosses the finish line, ahead of the rest, victorious. The crowd goes wild.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wink opens his trawl net and dumps a massive catch into a picking pan. There's food to feed a hundred in the haul. No one is a bit fazed though, this is just your average night fishing in the Bathtub. Shrimp, crabs, and small leaping fish struggle over one another for dear life. Hushpuppy helps him sort the catch. Winks's hands move with virtuosic ease, separating the crabs from the shrimp. She studies Wink's every move and tries to measure up to her Dad's proficiency. He doesn't demonstrate or explain anything, but we sense there is a system of education in place here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy focuses in on a tiny fish, wriggling and sucking it's last breaths of air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) One day, the storm's gonna blow, the ground's gonna sink, and the water's gonna rise up so high, there ain't gonna be no Bathtub, just a whole bunch of water. She pick up a crab, pets its belly. The DIN of the party fades down around her as she listens to its HEARTBEAT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Explosions everywhere as Bathtubers rampage blasting fireworks down the street instead of into the air. Men dressed as women, women dressed as men, in some kind of reckless esoteric ritual. The SCORE kicks in hard with a tinge of ominous forboding. We sense that in spite of the ecstatic energy, the unbridled joy, that a cloud hangs over this community. The people are parting like it's there last day on earth, and we feel viscerally, that it could be. Hushpuppy runs in the thick of it behind Wink waving a fountain sparkler. Wink trips and falls. Wink lies on his back on the ground. He sees his daughter watching him, holding the huge sparkler, and they both laugh with sheer joy. Hushpuppy stops over him and points a bottle rocket in his face, the fuse burning. He nods his approval. They watch the fuse burn down to the last moment. She turns it upward, and they watch her rocket join a sky filled with pluming mortars. Hushpuppy looks at the light flickering across Wink's faces. He's momentarily peaceful, admiring the spectacular display. Hushpuppy smiles at him with pride. He doesn't see her. They run off into the crowd, which is pulsating at the pinnacle of mayhem. The OMINOUS MUSIC shifts gears into a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the Bathtub. Throw your fist in the air! These are the survivors, those who fight for their joy and their history to the last man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) But me and my Daddy, we stay right here. We who the earth is for. Hushpuppy runs right at us with detonating fireworks in both hands, engulfed by light. She swings them toward camera and the screen is engulfed in an inferno of sparks. A white out. Black letters slam down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCHOOLBOAT - MORNING MUSIC CUTS abruptly as a basket of crawfish is slammed in front of camera. The crawfish squirming and struggling for life engulfs the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meat. A fearsome, uncompromising leader, sexy like a lady bullfighter, peeks at Hushpuppy over a mass of squirming crawfish. This is MISS BATHSHEBA (36). She points to three students, pushing their heads with her finger, each time announcing:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MEAT. MEAT. The twelve students follow her through a maze of creatures caged in mason jars, basins, and boxes with breathing holes- her educational tools.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fierce, mean creature that roamed the earth back when we all lived in caves. They would gobble the cave- babies down right in front of their cave-parents. And the cavemen couldn't do nothing about it, because they were too poor, too stupid, too small. Who here thinks the Cavemen were sitting around crying like a buncha pussies? Children stare blankly, no one raises their hand. Hushpuppy watches a heroic crawfish crest the basket, fall to the floor, and make a run for it. Miss Bathsheba snatches up the rogue crawdad and flings it back into the vat.

direction.raw_text: Y'all better think about that. Cause any day now, the fabric of the universe is coming unraveled. The ice caps gonna melt, the water's gonna rise, and everything south of the levee's going under. She points to a map showing a ragged coastline. On the wrong side of a giant line marked "levee" is an island labeled "The Bathtub."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't gonna be no Bathtub, just a whole bunch of water. Y'all better learn to survive. A mysterious COLD WIND fills the air. Hushpuppy stares into a wall poster of an ice cliff reading: THE SOUTH POLE.

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Way back in the day, the Aurochs was king of the world.

Hushpuppy waits alone, no one has come to get her. Miss Bathsheba locks up the door and heads for her small motor boat tied off on the side of the school.

direction.raw_text: Playing don't-touch-the-floor, Hushpuppy navigates her house. The room has with holes in the walls blocked with old clothes and paper towels. Homemade toys fill every surface. This is the domain of a child at loose ends. Hushpuppy leaps over her bed- a nook piled with clothes- and plugs in the Christmas lights.

Hushpuppy takes the jersey down. She puts it over a chair in the dining area. Hushpuppy gets a can of cat food. A pot. Water in a bowl. Her actions have a sad sense of routine to them- she's been left alone before, and has her own self-invented system for feeding herself. She opens a can of cat food, takes it out with her hand and throws it in a pot. She licks the remnants off her finger.

Hushpuppy grabs her basketball jersey off the chair and jumps over the breakfront counter. Behind her A MASSIVE GREASE EXPLOSION. Hushpuppy ducks down, panicking. She check over the median. The stove is on engulfed in flames. Hushpuppy scrambles under a cardboard box.

She draws a hieroglyphic of herself sad and crying on an island with a sun and a palm tree. She peeks out as Wink runs into the house, which is filled with black smoke, flickering flames.

Clutched in her hand is the hospital bracelet that Wink had been wearing. Bathsheba turns over the diagnostic bracelet and reads it, her eyes widen in recognition and alarm.

direction.raw_text: We see glimpses of nature protecting itself from the impending disaster. Flowers curl up, insects horde food underground, RUSTLING sounds fill the air. Black birds, and bats, and all manner of flying creatures fill the sky. They're all getting the hell out of dodge. Hushpuppy, quaking with fear, runs through a menacing swamp clutching her medicine jar. The rising winds swirl the marsh grass all around her. Hushpuppy runs to the spot where Wink collapsed. He's gone. Hushpuppy looks around the swamp, unable to understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Daddy could have turned into a tree, or a bug. There wasn't any way to know. Hushpuppy hides her medicine jar in her storage unit- a leather flap laid over the hollow of an oak tree. The hollow is filled with trinkets and objects she's collected over the years. Hushpuppy flinches as a shrieking animal calls out. She looks up to see a leaf covered in writhing caterpillars. One of them has been skewered by a beetle and is fighting for it's life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The whole universe depends on everything fitting together just right. If one piece busts, even the smallest piece, the entire universe will get busted.

direction.raw_text: Blocks of glaciers roll out of the avalanche and away from Antarctica like floating ice cubes. Embedded in each cube, is an Aurochs. A single ice cube takes over the frame and the mammoth dead Aurochs' eye stares right at us. Its jaw wide, its fangs bared, the ferocious beast appears to have fossilized mid- pounce. THUNDER BOOMS. We drift upwards into the cloud cover. As we rise above the white canopy, the spiral of a hurricane forms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: under HOWLING WINDS. We follow behind a little boy running down the road with an alarm bell as the people of the Bathtub mobilize in a frenzied evacuation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The storm's coming! The storm's coming!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy sulks out of the woods, feeling sorry for herself. She looks up and freezes like she's seen a ghost. Wink hobbles down the road, looking shell-shocked. The traffic on the road moves in one direction: out. Wink walks back into town in the opposite direction. In Hushpuppy's POV Wink arrives at Lady Jo's bar where a band of drunken sweethearts are in their regular positions. They are watching the evacuation go by like it's a Veteran's Day parade. They giggle and hurl good-natured curses out to a family making their way to safety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at these assholes running around all over the damn place. C'est la vie assholes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know y'all with me. Y'all doin' the storm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lady Jo's ain't never closed honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I'm talking about. Walrus my big man, you staying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wrong number buddy. I'm outta here as soon as I finish my beer. Wink dismisses him with a wave of his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ain't goin nowhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This ain't no sneeze comin' out the gulf. I'm gone brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll see you tomorrow Walrus. Lookit there, Winston's with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is passed out on the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you doing about the storm Winston? Without opening his eyes, Winston raises an umbrella over his head. Wink laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! It's Hushpuppy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy! Hushpuppy's here. They burst into a round of drunken applause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy? Where you been?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to y-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut-up! He lifts her up by the britches and carries her away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't talk!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the bus window, Hushpuppy watches Wink prepare for the storm as branches and debris fly by him. He RANTS to himself and drinks. He ties the Turck onto the house. Hushpuppy looks to where her animals lurch and freeze, run around in circles, pant heavily. They feel it coming. Rain drops start to spatter the window and Wink trips and falls trying to catch a fleeing chicken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, the full force of the storm HOWLS and CLATTERS the shutters. Rain screams against the corrugated metal roof. Wink tapes padding over all sharp corners and plastic wraps the furniture. He's Hushpuppy-proofing everything. He runs a piece of duct tape across the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This side is still Wink's house. No toys, and no girl stuff over here. Wink pushes charred toys from Hushpuppy's house across the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So if I want to come over that side and smack you in the face, that's against the rules. So there's a plus for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy is not able to see the bright side here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now come on down here and get in the boat, man. He points to a trunk on the floor. Hushpuppy hops down and gets in. Wink sits on his air mattress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If the water get real high, we gonna float to the top and we gonna bust through the roof and we gonna ride away, okay? Wink puts a pair of mismatching water wings on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never NEVER take these off. I'm your Daddy, and you do what I tell you to do, because it's my job to keep you from dying, ok? So sit back and just listen to me... Close your eyes and go to sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: YOUR EYES! Hushpuppy watches Wink pretending to sleep. The THUNDER scares the bejesus out of him again. She looks to the ceiling where water is starting to pour in steadily. Looks back at Wink who is sneaking a sip from his liquor bottle. He resumes his phony sleep. A strong gust of wind JOLTS the entire room and he springs out of bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why you starin' at me like that? I can't sleep with you starin' at me like that. Wink paces the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen. You need to understand, you're a kid and I'm a man. She doesn't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, you scared? Hushpuppy nods. THUNDER BOOMS and Wink is the one who flinches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be scared, no storm can't beat no Doucet. I'm gonna show you. You watch. But he can see she's still scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm'll show you! We Doucets we're not scared of no damn storm. Wink grabs a bottle of moonshine and climbs down the hatch in the floor into the storm. Hushpuppy runs to the window and peeks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The frenzy of the hurricane propels Wink at full sprint through the 100 MPH winds. He tears his clothes off and guzzles moonshine as branches fall all around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at me! Look at me Hushpuppy! Watch me kick butt. Wink fires his shotgun at the heavens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell yea! I'm right here! I'm right here I ain't going nowhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shakes the house so hard a ceiling beam
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: down. Hushpuppy runs to her bed as if it might keep her safe. Windell, swinging from a basket tied to the ceiling, BARKS, panicking herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mamma!? MAMMA!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PATAGONIAN COAST - NIGHT Still in the rainstorm, a glacial cube SHATTERS, flopping a mammoth body onto the shoreline. It's chest heaves and a LOW SNORT is heard. The animal begins to roll over. Her dinosaur size hoof plants in the mud as she lifts herself up. We stare over the muscular haunch of her body as she stares into the distance. The massive creature turns, testing her limbs after thousands of years of sleep. She looks up to the storm and lets loose a GURGLING ROAR. We sit close on one of her black eyes. There is something dangerously sad in her cold gaze. Her head moves from the frame as she starts forward on her journey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AERIAL BATHTUB - DAY Silence. The storm has passed. The camera flies high over the Bathtub. The tops of houses poke out from the massive water like lily-pads in a pond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A slab of metal stares at us, surrounded by water. Something under the metal BANGS TWICE and an axe dislodges a roof panel. The axe twists and leverages off the slab. Wink hefts Hushpuppy on top of the roof. Then Windell. Dishevelled and hung-over, he pulls himself up too. The three survivors stare in stunned silence at their new world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wink slowly navigates the Turck in through the flooded landscape where their town had once been. Neither he nor Hushpuppy can say a word. Everything is submerged. Every organism is dead or has fled. The quiet is overwhelming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) For every animal that didn't have a Dad to put it in a boat, the end of the world already happened. They're all down below, trying to breathe through water. They pass abandoned house, after abandoned house, the ones on stilts have water up to the porches. Trees are bashed through roofs, walls are blown through, bathrooms exposed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wink uses a pole to open a door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo Winston? No one answers. They push off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wink enters an intact house with water up to the porch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Edison? Ow-Wee! Wink leans against the door frame. From his POV we see Hushpuppy on the Turck. She picks a leaf and eats it. Wink shakes his head in dismay, realizing all too clearly his girl is not ready for survival.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Turck passes through a net of Spanish moss into the belly of a swamp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some day when I'm gone, you gonna be the last man in the bathtub. You have to learn how to feed your house. Wink goes to the edge of the turck and sticks his hand in the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, stick your left hand in this water, stick it in there. Hushpuppy puts her right hand in the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ok, what you do is you hold your hand steady and you just wait for your fish to come. You gotta ball your fist up, this is your punching hand. Ball your fist up in case you have to whack it when they come up. Wink pulls a Catfish out with his bare hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WHOOOOO YEA! Whooo lord, look what we got. I gotcha. Say "I gotcha!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotcha! Wink slams the fish down on the floor of the Turck and pins it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yea! Hold him down! Now, you hold it down like this, and whack him good with your fist. Wink pins the fish and punches it in the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead whack him! You whack him good. Hold him like that and whack him! Hushpuppy pins the fish. She tries to whack it and it cuts her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! She hides her cut hand from Wink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You OK? That's all a part of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy winces in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna try it again? Hushpuppy shakes her head no, trying not to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. One more time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy has enclosed herself under a table with a tablecloth on it. She's drawing on the floor with charcoal. Something alive hits the roof and scurries across. We hear the entire house MOAN, or was it a distant ROAR?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy? Wink's hacking cough, which has gotten worse since last we heard it, fills the room. Hushpuppy tries to shake him awake. Hushpuppy looks through the gap in his shirt. On Wink's chest, surrounding his heart, a corroded spider web of purple bruises shows through the skin, like varicose veins covering his entire heart. Hushpuppy's eyes go wide with horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The beacon pulses on the distant horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mamma? Is that you? The beacon does not respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've broken everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DESERT - DAY A cloud of dust circulates particles. The Haze is blinding. A distant RUMBLING grows. Dark shapes tear through the haze in a deafening stampede.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Strong animals, they know when your hearts are weak. That makes them hungry and they start coming. We see one at first, then more join rank around it. The Aurochs are charging in a pack. They are a biblical terror; the horsemen of the apocalypse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The turck moves through the cypress forest, signs are strewn everywhere pointing to Lady Jo's bar. It appears abandoned. Suddenly, the door SQUEAKS open. Walrus winces at the sunlight and pops a beer. He steps out the door and SPLASHES into the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy bowlegged Sarah!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey partner! Hey Walrus! Wink pulls in the Turck and paddles to rescue the thrashing drunkard. They leverage Walrus aboard and lay him out on deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gauging his surroundings) I musta passed out. Wink starts chuckling silently. His chuckle builds to a laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They enter the bar, empty bottles, half eaten crabs, and general party debris are littered everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little Jo is sprawled on the floor under a table. Is she dead or just wasted?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little Jo! She awakes with a start and bangs her head on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wink!? Wink and Walrus run to help her up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (TO WALRUS) You don't touch me you filthy bastard! (TO WINK) Wink, you get me. They both lift her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goin' on all night `bout how tonight's the last night on earth we gotta make it count. Talkin' dirty right in front of Peter T.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry Peter T. Peter T enters from the Bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter T, my man! I knew you wasn't gonna leave me man! Peter T speaks in his polite, level-headed, soft sweet voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no, oh no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (re: Peter T) That is one classic dude right there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter T, you are a titan! Glad you stayed man! RHHAAAA!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wink jiggles Peter T's ample belly. Peter T giggles with glee. Wink puts one arm around Walrus and the other around Peter T. He smiles to Hushpuppy. She laughs too, the first smile in quite some days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Bathtub crew are lolling in the later party stages. There is a rooster on the table looking like the most sober creature in the room by far.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I had wings, I know I could have flown in that bad boy. But I would have probably bounced off a tree, or... Hushpuppy lays on the table in pile of empty crab shells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy! Did I ever tell you the story of your conception? The bar crowd chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When me and Hushpuppy's Mamma first met we was so shy, we used to sit around, and drink beer, and smile at each other. One day we was so shy we just napped... Wink's voice FADES DOWN as Hushpuppy's fantasy takes over. She closes her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wink, younger and prettier, naps in an uncharacteristically colorful lawn chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wakes him up. There in the yard, crawling slow and lazy, is a massive 15- foot alligator, breathing the heavy, slutty way alligators breathe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A topless woman steps in front. Sweat beading on her perfect shoulder blades, down her perfect, back ending in a pair of boys' underpants- just like Hushpuppy's. Throughout Hushpuppy's vision, we never see Marietta's face, it's always covered, shot from the back, or out of frame. Marietta cocks the shotgun with one hand, Terminator 2 style. Lowers it on the gator...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Wink sits up in SLOW MOTION- her panties, and her long naked legs are covered with gator blood. She turns to Wink, her head ABOVE FRAME.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP on her eye. She winks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We follow behind Marietta's supple curves as she walks into the kitchen. Her white slip is almost see through...almost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Back when Daddy used to talk about Mamma, he'd say she was so pretty she never even had to turn on the stove. She runs her fingers along the counter and the burners IGNITE one by one as she passes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) She just walk into a room and water start to boil. Water starts to bubbles like a spontaneous volcanic eruption. Marietta reaches into the frigidaire, and pulls out two ice- cold beers. Ice melts down the bottles. She opens them on the counter, flawlessly. She walks over to Wink. Stands there. A hot mess. Wink's voice FADES UP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Your Momma battered that gator up, and set it to fry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wink tips his drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and Hushpuppy popped into the universe maybe four minutes later. He empties the glass, sufficiently drunk now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got it under control. Wink looks away, lost in his own fantasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over Marietta's shoulder, beads of sweat form along the strap of her slip. Good Lord. Wink looks, and meets her eyes. The gaze of a proud and smitten man. Grits fall through the chimney vent, into the boiling water. Dancing like all the invisible particles of the universe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy stares hard, her face locked in pride and determination. Filling with all the strength and heroism of her long-lost mother. She's ready to snap into action.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drops and we move in a semi-montage through Hushpuppy's search for survivors. Hushpuppy rows the Turck through the flooded Bathtub by herself. In the distance she sees a lone horse. It stands on an tiny island of land, the last high ground in an endless stretch of water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The horse holds Hushpuppy's gaze. She hears it's strong, resilient HEARTBEAT. They are one and the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy approaches Schoolboat, which has weathered the storm relatively intact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Bathsheba!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy opens the door. We hear RUSTLING and WHISPERING inside school. It's three little girls left behind in the storm. JOY STRONG, a tall, wild-haired leader; LIZARD, a tiny thing in a giant man's tee shirt, and T-LOU, the muscle of this girl gang, looking very meek in her desperate condition. The girls are huddled against each other, terrified, hungry, and alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Bathsheba, shell-shocked but steadfast, steers the boat toward the bar, the four girls now safely in her care. From the inside we hear CAROUSING, TOASTING, and RAUCOUS CAJUN MUSIC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wink pours a mountain of crab and shrimp at a great communal table, assembled from many different tables.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on lets go! Time to eat! Come on children, feed up time! He sends a feast sliding across the floor under the table, where Joy, T-Lou, and Lizard dig in. Wink has decorated the bar with all the waterlogged relics of the Bathtub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room is a shrine of people's chairs, umbrellas, clothing. We're late in the game, and the party has descended into utter debauchery. Jean raises a glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the last of the food!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the last of the water!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ain't drinkin' no water. Miss Bathsheba pour shots and toasts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yea, tastes like more, alright! Hushpuppy struggles to peel her shrimps, sitting on top of the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) For the ones we'd never find, we make a funeral the Bathtub way, with no crying allowed. Drunken Wink is giving drunken Walrus a bath as he eats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When the water goes down, I'm gonna French kiss the dirt!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Water's not goin' down man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah, that's my beautiful place under there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man you know they got plenty of salt coming into that water, everything beautiful is gone. Trees are gonna dies first, then the animals, then the fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got it under control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy picks up a crab. She tries to pound it open, tries yanking on a leg. She can't shell it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on Hushpuppy, come over here lemme show you how. Hushpuppy sits down next to Jean, a good pupil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here baby. You hold like this, then you turn it over like that. Hushpuppy follows instruction in deep concentration, but a bit tentative. We see Wink look away from Walrus and Jo's bawdy humor extravaganza and focus in on Hushpuppy. His disdain is palpable for this froufrou shelling technique.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be scared of it now. Now, you take this knife, and you pop this off. Jean holds Hushpuppy's hand and guides a knife to open the belly of the crab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Atta girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Hushpuppy-- Wink POUNDS the table. And the party falls suddenly silent. Wink pushes the utensil away. He grabs a crab, opens it in three virtuosic hand motions. Grease and spice explode everywhere and Wink sucks the face of the crab clean. It is beautiful to watch. He slams a fresh crab in front of Hushpuppy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beast it! Hushpuppy looks to Miss Bathsheba for guidance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard your Daddy. Beast it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy pulls on the crab shell with all her might. She doesn't have the power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BEAST IT! BEAST IT! BEAST IT! The kids jump out from under the table and chant. Hushpuppy is turning blue, her eyes bulge with effort...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Hushpuppy opens the crab claw and sucks down the meat. Everyone goes wild with applause! The kids too! Hushpuppy stands up, ascending to the top of the table. She lets loose a WARRIOR CRY and flexes her muscles, deadly triumphant. Little Jo gets so excited she starts dancing on the table. She CACKLES and jitterbugs wildly. Walrus gets up to join her. Jean gets up and dances too. All the kids get up. Wink glows with pride. Miss Bathsheba smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yea! You see what kinda family we got?! We got feeling!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: kicks in as we MONTAGE through the transformation of the Schoolboat into a ramshackle Ark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) It wasn't no time to sit around crying like a bunch of pussies. The survivors whittle sticks into spears, bend metal debris into spikes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) We was gonna build a camp right on top of the Bathtub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jean Battiste, cackling wildly, hauls a thrashing goat onto a floating animal pen. Chicken coops, snake cages, a pig pen are stacking precariously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got enough animals to eat until the water goes down. Rafts are lashed to the sides of the school. Every floating structure left in town is hauled in and added to the Ark. Peter T ties on a floating vegetable garden. In WIDE we see what looks like a small village of floating structures forming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Bathsheba puts Lizard's head in her lap, Lizard is playing as if she's unconscious after hyperventilating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (teaching a lesson) Come here, like this. She takes Hushpuppy's hand and places it on Lizard's chest. She moves her hand in a circular motion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like this. Tee-Lou get some water. Tee-Lou runs to get a handful of water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quick little circles. Good for the heart. Joy Strong? Joy turns her back. Miss Bathsheba shakes her head. Tee-Lou returns and pours water on Lizard's head, cooling her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is most important thing I can ever teach y'all. You got to take care of people that's smaller and sweeter than you are. Hushpuppy registers this advice, takes it to heart. She rubs Lizard's chest with delicacy and affection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lizard's breathing returns to normal, and she sits up peacefully. Hushpuppy is awestruck. Bathsheba gets to her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy watches Wink sleeping. His breathing has gotten worse. She tiptoes up with her red basketball jersey and lays it down on Wink, tucking him in just right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is heard. Cutting off suddenly as we...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A quiet town, not unlike the Bathtub, but with tangled power- lines, electrical towers, and layered hills. A stone flies from behind a house and bounces down the street, denting the silence. Slowly, the peaceful morning transitions into MORE RUMBLING, a distant CRACK. Suddenly the house in the foreground explodes to smithereens and the head of an Aurochs drives through it. Without breaking step, Aurochs maraud the village, trampling it into oblivion. We settle close on an Aurochs eye, emotionless and relentless in its calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wink, Hushpuppy, and the Bathtub crew pole the Turck through a lake blanketed with carcasses, pushing through the dead fish, dead porpoises, dead alligator garfish like they were lily pads. There is no wind, only dense wet heat searing on the faces of the characters. The once green foliage has gone brown and thirsty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .O. Two weeks later, everything started to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the water) Come on fishes, where y'at? Wink empties his net- nothing but a pile of carcasses. He tips it back into the water. Wink pulls himself to the edge and sticks his head under to look for fish. Hushpuppy looks at him with an air of doubt for the first time. Wink looks ridiculous, a dead fish drifts off his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna leave the Bathtub, Walrus?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah. Wink pulls his head back up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard that. Hushpuppy fidgets guiltily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody's leaving the Bathtub! You don't know nothing! Wink lowers his net back in the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This water gonna kill us here. We gotta do something `bout this. I ain't starvin' to death while them people go grocery shopping up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kids sleep on Miss Bathsheba in a big pile on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy wakes hearing SHIFTING and a SNAP behind her. Peter T is uncapping a shotgun shell and pouring black powder into a small jar. She looks out the window where Jean Battiste is unhooking a propane container from Miss Bathsheba's burner. He opens her chest freezer and hefts out a 12-foot garfish, dropping the container in the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit! Wink sneaks up and whispers to Hushpuppy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boss, Daddy's gotta take care of something. Hushpuppy is instantly concerned, she's heard this line before, and it always leads to trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna fix everything back how it was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything gonna go right back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell yeah, we gonna win. Wink pounds his chest in solidarity. Hushpuppy matches his pound, but without confidence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boss, anything go wrong, Walrus is Daddy. Wink and Hushpuppy look Walrus-- the face of doddering drunken bewilderment. A goat licks him. Hushpuppy is not comforted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joy, Tee-Lou, Lizard, and Hushpuppy swim through open water, pulling each other forward. They head in the direction of the beacon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on! Keep going! They try to kick toward the light but are getting nowhere, the current pulls them backwards. We hear a BOAT HORN and they look to where an ANCIENT TUG BOAT with a cabin that towers into the sky like a giraffe head, appears through the mist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girls climb aboard, lifting each other onto the deck. They look up to the sound of FOOTSTEPS on the upper deck. Hushpuppy looks up to see SERGEANT MAJOR (60) - A big, timeless looking man with a salt and pepper moustache, saunters up to the rail. He stares down, examining these runts with an air of suspicion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going by my Mamma. He smiles broadly, as if this was the secret password. Him and Hushpuppy stare at each other and immediately there is understanding. Two lost souls in the wilderness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a good place to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GULF OF MEXICO - SERGEANT MAJOR'S BOAT - EVENING Hushpuppy sits adjacent to the Sergeant in the tug's elevated wheelhouse. They are two stories up, and the white walls create a glow that makes us feel like we're almost in another dimension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which way are we going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't matter baby, this boat'll take you exactly where you need to be. It's just that type of boat. Hushpuppy and Sergeant Major share an ease unlike anyone else we've seen Hushpuppy interacted with. The speak like an old teacher with his favorite disciple. They let their silences last.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want a chicken biscuit? Hushpuppy shakes her head `no'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're good for you. A deep, far away melancholy settles over him. He munches on a chicken biscuit, then tosses the wrapper on the floor. The wheelhouse is wall to wall with chicken biscuit wrappers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I been eating these all my life. I keep the wrappers in the boat, `cause they remind me who I was when I ate each one. The smell make me feel cohesive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna be cohesive. SERGEANT MAJOR Oh you will be, I got no doubt in my mind. They let this thought settle, then Hushpuppy turns her swivel chair back toward the water
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The beacon appears through the mist. Hushpuppy's eyes go wide. As they approach, another boat comes into view. A half- sunken barge that looks as though its been rusting in the same position for a century. As we move in we see a lit up sign: "Elysian Fields Floating Catfish Shack GIRLS GIRLS GIRLS."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy, Joy, Tee-Lou, and Lizard disembark onto the barge with Sergeant Major following behind. They circle around a hatch in the floor with light pulsing out of it. Far-away
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: echoes up from the bowels of the ship. They look to each other in wonder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy descends a ladder into a glimmering wonderland. Christmas lights swallow the ceiling, and a light smoke facade encompasses everything. We feel like we're looking at a portal into the past, a Belloq-esque turned New Orleans Jazz parlor. The regulars are all oil-workers wooing their ladies of the night. There is a stage with a DJ and two singers, karaokeing along with "Until the Real Thing Comes Along" by Fats Waller. The hyperactive MISS FRANKIE, the matriarch of this establishment, comes a'hoppin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy crap you have toddlers!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good afternoon, Miss Frankie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well butter my butt and call me a biscuit! How you, Sergeant Major? You need some grits?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy Sugar, they are so precious! Y'all just as cute as a tub of puppies! Women descend on the kids who recoil, not knowing what to do with all this affection. Joy Strong puts up her fists. Hushpuppy pushes through the crowd nonplussed by the flurry of doting ladies. They are not who she is looking for. They are not who she is looking for. She scans pictures of strippers through the ages pasted up all over the ceiling, each of them with a bra hung on it, none of them right. Bar patrons nod and tip their glasses to her as she passes, ladies smile and return to their drinks, drunk flirtatious dancers giggle at her, but she remains unfazed. She reaches two swinging doors that lead to the kitchen. Hushpuppy stops. Sniffs. Heaven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : in Hushpuppy's POV, smoke curls through the swinging doors, the light illuminating the dust particles. It's a magic kitchen. Her POV tilts down to the floor where a pair of well-pedicured feet in flip-flops walks towards the swinging doors. They open. Hushpuppy holds her breath. A gorgeous COOK (35) wearing a baseball cap and an apron comes out the double doors. She wipes some sweat off her brow. She watches the band and kills a bottle of ice-cold beer. The Cook looks down. Sees Hushpuppy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need something baby? Hushpuppy nods, holding her breath. She still can't speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well whatchu want? You alone? Hushpuppy shrugs. She's too stunned, too shy to speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Cook takes stock of the helpless creature in front of her. Like a butcher shop owner with a pesky hungry puppy, she submits to Hushpuppy's longing gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in here, I'm'll show you a magic trick. Hushpuppy follows her into the magic kitchen, knocking her head against the swinging doors on her way in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the smooth fanfare of a circus performer, The Cook lifts an egg, opens a beer bottle with her teeth, SPITS the cap at the egg and it cracks over the grits. Hushpuppy's face is joy beyond all measure. She watches the Cook's flying hands, she prepares everything in a single motion, it's like a dance. She slaps a fresh alligator tail on the table and begins sawing through the scales.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lemme tell you somethin', when you're a child people tell you that everything's gonna be all hunky- dory and all that bullshit, but I'm here to tell you that it's not. So get that out your head right now. She removes the knife from the gator and aims it at Hushpuppy like its a pointer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Life's some big old feast, yeah, but you? You ain't nothin' but a stupid little waitress. She scales a gator, strips the bones, dredges, fries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything you got on your platter gonna fall on the floor and ain't nobody gonna be there to pick it up for you. Someday it's all gonna be on you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stirs the grits. Grits on plate. Gator on plate. Plate in front of Hushpuppy. Lemon is squeezed all over everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So smile, girl. Hushpuppy tries to crack a grin. She barely remembers how to smile and it comes out all wrong. The Cook shakes her head, opens another beer on her teeth, and heads for the pantry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody likes a pity-party-having- ass-woman. Hushpuppy stays behind staring into the floating particles of dust in the incandescent light-- stars of the universe. The golden bubbling fry pot-- lava of the molten core.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four perfect gator nuggets are placed next to a sumptuous dollop of grits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gator's magic. Hushpuppy looks up from her food-hypnosis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (encouraging a smile) Awwwwwwwww. A real smile emerges across Hushpuppy's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mmm-hmm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Magic soars as the couples rock back and forth on the dance floor. Strippers cradle their dates. It's all very sweet and tender. This seems to be the M.O of this strip club, slow-dance not pole-dance. The kids are each dancing with a stripper, glowing with love. They are orphans in a heaven of mothers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We float back to Hushpuppy, the camera dances with her and the Cook. The Cook squeezes Hushpuppy and spins her. Each time we catch their face their eyes are wetter and wetter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can take care of me. Me and Daddy. After a long beat. The Cook shakes her head `no.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know nothing bout your Daddy, I can't take care of nobody but myself. This sinks into Hushpuppy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can stay if you want. Hushpuppy considers this for a moment, squeezes the Cook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my favorite thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. A far-away look has come over her. Her mind is somewhere else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I can count all the time I've been lifted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We look up at a face that's slowly coming into focus- it's Wink, younger and healthier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I can count all the times I've been lifted on two fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is the first sight of the slimy newborn baby girl tucked in his arm. Baby Hushpuppy stares up at him as he carries her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) Wink! Bring my baby here! They need to wash her off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw, that waits. Baby Hushpuppy's huge-eyed, warped facial expression ogles Wink. She coos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright fatso, breathe some air. They pass through a doorway and sun washes over Baby Hushpuppy. She smiles and smiles at the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back in reality Hushpuppy gathers herself. She's suddenly not hugging back, just being held.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to go home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Hushpuppy cups her hand to the Cook's ear and whispers something inaudible. The Cook squeezes her tight, seeming on the verge of adopting her. But she can't. She spins Hushpuppy around and around, then puts her down withouth meeting her gaze. Hushpuppy watches her disappear into the crowd of swaying couples. All goes quiet, and we sit behind Hushpuppy's head, a sea of light like a crown around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Decisively, with the force of a charging general, Hushpuppy turns and runs toward camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DEAD OAK RIDGE - DAY MATCH CUT to Hushpuppy leading Joy, Tee-Lou, and Lizard across a ridge dotted with Dead Oak trees, she's come back to the Bathtub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The camera moves over the water, past the dead oaks. We turn the corner past a stretch of marsh, and come upon the Aurochs, four of them, now suddenly and viscerally in the landscape of the Bathtub, swimming steadily toward solid land.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Bathtub crew sits by Wink's bed. His eyes are open, but everyone is silently waiting for the inevitable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The children crest the ridge. The RUMBLE of Aurochs hoofs is suddenly and violently audible. Hushpuppy turns. She catches a glimpses of something massive moving behind the distant oaks. The kids turn and hustle down the ridge. Hushpuppy, Joy, Tee-Lou, and Lizard hustle down hill with increased urgency. The DISTANT TRAMPLING is growing louder. Behind Hushpuppy the dark shapes of the Aurochs crest the ridge in a deafening STAMPEDE. Joy, Tee-Lou, and Lizard scream and sprint out in front of Hushpuppy. Hushpuppy walks steadily forward, refusing to run. Her face locked with determination, she is unafraid. Her eyes shoot toward the shacko.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wink, with all his strength looks toward Hushpuppy, their eyes meet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Wink's POV, Hushpuppy stops dead on the bridge, waiting for her fate, staring toward her father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Aurochs bear down on Hushpuppy from behind, their footsteps rattling the frame. They grow inconceivably large, the camera has to tilt to hold the frame. Hushpuppy balls her fists and stands her ground. Suddenly, she turns. The Aurochs ROARS. Then, inches away from Hushpuppy, she stops. She SNORTS, blowing Hushpuppy's hair back. Hushpuppy doesn't flinch. The Aurochs stares face to face with Hushpuppy. Sniffs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wink is frozen in wonder, unable to believe his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy raises her chin in confident defiance. Now in full profile, we see the Aurochs towering 15-feet tall, she takes a step forwards, sniffs again. A low SNORT, or is it a purr? The Aurochs lowers her head with respect. Her eyes well with emotion, recognizing one of her own. A ferocious warrior. The Aurochs steps back, takes a knee, and with a BELLY FLOP that rattles the very earth, she lays down. Her three companions follow suit, their fat tummies settling into an almost joyful, lazy, repass. A strange calm has settled over Hushpuppy. Almost a smile, but more of a peace and an affection for her equal. They're both children in their way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're my friend, kind of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother Aurochs grunts, a sentence only Hushpuppy can understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta take care of mine. With weary and clumsy steps, the Aurochs stand and retreat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hushpuppy approaches the shacko. It's like walking the plank, but she's unafraid, at one with her destiny. The Bathtub crew look on her in awe. They part ways to let her pass. She reaches the door, steeling her reserve. Hushpuppy opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wink is curled up on Hushpuppy's bed-- very, very thin. His eyes are closed. His chest heaves up and down in short violent breaths. Hushpuppy stands and stares. Wink looks at Hushpuppy in reverence. He knows it's the last time. Wink motions for her to come closer. Hushpuppy inches toward him. It takes all of her might. She sits on his bed. Hushpuppy takes her to-go container from Elysian Fields out of a paper bag and pops it. She unwraps a gator nugget, dips it in hot sauce, and holds it out for Wink to take a bite. Hushpuppy watches as Wink chews weakly. She eats one herself. Wink and Hushpuppy draw it out. They don't want it to end. It takes a full minute for him to swallow the first bite, and she paces herself to finish when he does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Real good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wink's chest heaves up and down, harder and harder. A tear rolls down his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No crying, you hear? She holds them back, being tough for her Daddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No crying. Hushpuppy's face hardens, and even as the tears fall, we see a strength and composure that only Wink could have put there. She falls into his arms and he embraces her. Hushpuppy squeezes Wink. She does not let go. She stays strong. Wink's hand trembles on her back. She holds him as his deep, warm, heartbeat slows, slows, and stops. His weight slumps over her. She keeps on holding him, but she knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steadfast, Hushpuppy holds a torch on the edge of the Bathtub. The Turck, piled with branches, floats in front of her. She lowers the flame and lights a cloth covering Wink's body aflame. She pushes the funeral pyre out into the current. We watch the boat flames drift into the foreground, covering Hushpuppy face with flames. She looks into them in all her grief and wisdom. The group begins a funeral prayer, playing quiet in the background as Hushpuppy contemplates the pyre.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As I stand by the bayou, Everyone else joins him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A ship at my side starts her motors and sails for the gulf. I watch her until she disappears. "There! (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's gone!" Gone where? Gone from my eyes, that's all. She's just as big as when she left me. And somewhere else, other voices are calling out, "Here she comes!" And that is dying. They raise their drinks to the sky and shout in unison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: HERE! SHE! COMES! Hushpuppy gazes into the sparks leaping off the top of the fire are foregrounded in front of Hushpuppy, particles of Wink jumping into the sky. HORNS ENTER, droning low, and building into an funeral dirge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) When I relax behind my eyes I see everything that made me flying around in invisible pieces. When I look too hard it goes away, but when it all goes quiet, I see they are right here. The Turck almost disappears over the horizon. The HORNS take a hopeful turn, the melancholy of the dirge mixing with the anthem of the Bathtub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I see that I'm a little piece of a big, big universe, and that makes things right. Hushpuppy stands tiny on the ledge of the Earth, framed in front of an expanse of endless water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Bathtub gang marches across the marsh road. Hands touch the town sign, saying goodbye.
direction.name: direction
